title: 108_hr4740
content: The "Jobs for America Act of 2004" is the short title of this Act. It includes amendments to the Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification Act. The Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification Act is amended to define 'offshoring of jobs' as actions by employers resulting in employment loss for 15 or more employees. The Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification Act is amended to extend the notification period from 60 to 90 days and to allow for notifications to be made to the Secretary of Labor. Additionally, the Act is amended to change the timeframe for multiple layoffs from within any 90-day period to within any 180-day period. The Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification Act is amended to extend the notification period from 60 to 90 days. Notices must now include information on the number of jobs affected, the location of work transfer, and the reasons for the transfer. The Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification Act is amended to include offshoring of jobs in the definition of plant closings and mass layoffs. Civil actions against employers are also addressed in the amendments. The Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification Act is amended to extend the notification period from 60 to 90 days. It also includes consequential damages for aggrieved employees and addresses bad faith actions by employers. The Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification Act may award treble damages to those enforcing the Act, and requires posting of employee rights. The Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification Act mandates the development of a notice of employee rights by the Secretary of Labor within 60 days of enactment. Employers are required to post this notice in a visible location at the workplace. Additionally, the Act now includes a provision for annual reports by the Secretary of Labor. The Secretary of Labor is required to compile statistics on offshoring of jobs and submit a report to the President and Congress within 120 days of each regular session. The report must include details on the number of jobs affected, locations of work transfers, reasons for shifts, and other relevant data.
